question: What changes has Tracy observed in her neighborhood in the outer Mission?
answer: Tracy has observed that there are primarily single-family homes around her area, but towards Alemany, more apartment buildings are popping up. In the business districts on Mission and Geneva, many businesses have remained the same for about 10 years, and the same bus lines have been around, indicating not much change in her neighborhood.
source_text: Tracy and most of my family is physically from The Bayview District more towards like mission I live in the outer Mission and its primarily like a single family homes around my area towards alimony which is a busier Street theres started to be more apartment buildings popping up and by Balboa Park theres been one more and the business districts on Mission and Geneva a lot of the businesses have are the same ones from like 10 years ago so theyve been doing well and transportation those same bus lines have been around so not much change in my neighborhood

question: What has Jackie observed about housing and business development in Bayview?
answer: Jackie has seen a lot of housing development in Bayview, particularly on the east side of the city, with a mix of taller buildings and single-family homes. She has also observed businesses coming and going, with some long-standing ones continuing to do well.
source_text: for me like I said I was born and raised in Bayview and thats where Ive seen a lot of housing develop in our city I know most of its been on the east side of the city and thats where the Bay View is um Ive lived primarily in like one or two homes in the babies that havent moved often uh and most of the or I guess its a mix of taller buildings and also um single family homes in the Bayview and I think especially in like the silver tirins area weve seen a lot of development weve seen taller buildings um and in the Hunters Point area too theres a lot of development there and in terms of the businesses in the area I think Ive seen businesses come and go whether theyre supermarkets theres ice cream shops so I think um theres its a mix theres also ones that have been in the neighborhood for a while and that continued to be continue to be doing really well

question: What public services and spaces does Jackie find important in San Francisco?
answer: Jackie finds having a public library nearby, open spaces like parks, and being close to a commercial corridor with retail shops and local businesses important. She values these public services and spaces for their contribution to making San Francisco a more livable place.
source_text: for me I think when I when I heard the question I mostly thought about public spaces public services and personally I think I found having for example like a public library nearby really important having Open Spaces Club Parks areas to to just jog outside or spend time outside um that to be really important too as well as um as well as having um or being close to like a commercial Corridor where we have retail shops where we have local businesses um supermarkets um yeah I found out to be really important as well

question: What improvements would you like to see in your neighborhood regarding community spaces?
answer: I would love to see the implementation of a better community space in my neighborhood. There's a community in the southern neighborhoods, but there's not a big push for it to be shown. I'd love for a better initiative for more community building.
source_text: y here its theres one like in the Excelsior but its pretty far away from where I live and so I would love to see like the implementation of just like a better like community space in my neighborhood I think also with like the shared spaces program that SF has and has like popped up during the epidemic I think its really nice its actually moved that more down like Southern to the southern neighborhoods like um the otter Mission or participation Valley or the Bay View I think a lot of these communities there is community there but theres not a big push for it to be actually shown and so Id love for a better like Initiative for more community building in our neighborhoods

question: How has Cayuga Park changed recently?
answer: Recently, two gardeners have been hired to keep the park clean, making it feel safer. Now, I feel safe in the morning, and elderly people can walk around the circle safely.
source_text: I uh also in the outer Mission so uh I grew I grew up going to Cayuga Park and its like next to the freeway so its like at times noisy so it might make people not want to go there and then there used to be overgrown like uh weeds and like bushes so it was kind of unsafe in like the hillsides so it deters people from going there but uh Ive seen recently that the gar there have been two gardeners who have been hired and theyve just been doing a great job like keeping the park clean and now I feel like in the morning uh I can even I can feel safe and theres a lot of elderly people who are able to like walk around the circle and I feel like they could be safe too now

question: What are some issues with the distribution of resources in different neighborhoods of San Francisco?
answer: There are disparities in resources between neighborhoods. For example, the Bayview has issues with food access and air quality, and schools face budget cuts. In contrast, the Marina has nice resources and parks.
source_text: I can kind of start so I went to school at Marina middle school and also I go to Galileo now so its like in that little District where its like kind of the marina and I always say that the marina is so like there are a lot of like nice resources there for the community members but I will say the same type of really like applicable to my neighborhood like for example they have the whole like Moscone Park its really nice um the people that run it are also really nice theyre part of like I think the Rex and Parks team but I also say their neighbor theres like libraries are really nice and its really close to the water which is I guess you cant really have that in mind neighborhood because mines like Nautica all close to the water but its like the whole neighborhood in general just theres so many like nice like like I dont know wide streets and theres like theres a lot of like nice I guess like trees and like bushes like that where I cant like say the same thing for my neighborhood but I will say that like after like going to school there for so long Ive like noticed a drastic change between the two neighborhoods

question: What are some examples of disparities in San Francisco's education system?
answer: There are budget cuts targeting schools throughout the southeast side of the city, such as James Denman, James Lick, and Visitation Valley. These disparities are deep-rooted and ingrained in different systems, including the education system.
source_text: we also had budget cuts targeted School targeting schools throughout the southeast side of our city we had like James Denman um James lick visitation Valley and yeah I think these are just like examples of how disparities in our city are so deep rooted and its ingrained in like different systems including our education system

question: What are the differences in resources between neighborhoods in San Francisco?
answer: Neighborhoods with more resources, like the west side, have better schools and more green space, whereas the northeast or southeast are denser and have fewer resources.
source_text: neighborhoods that I think have more resources would be like the west side because theres um its less packed so I and um theres also better schools and like more green space whereas like um like the northeast or like the southeast has more like uh dense and there tends to be less of that uh less resources

question: What difficulties do new immigrants and veterans face in San Francisco?
answer: New immigrants with language barriers and veterans with trauma may find it hard to access jobs, which are crucial for starting a good life.
source_text: people coming into San Francisco like maybe new immigrants with like a language barrier or maybe like uh formerly like people went to war back then like uh former veterans if theyre coming back with like trauma or like immigrants are coming with a language barrier it might be hard to access like jobs which are like one of the most important things to uh getting someone started uh in a good life

question: Why do some San Francisco residents plan to leave the city?
answer: Many residents love San Francisco but find it unrealistic to stay due to high living costs, leading them to plan to live elsewhere and commute.
source_text: a lot of my fellow peers like a lot of them have such like a deep love of San Francisco too and I know a lot of the adults have spoken to also share that same like commitment the same thing same like passion for San Francisco where theyd love to stay in the city but it simply is like unrealistic so a lot of them are making plans to either um not return to the city after pursuing higher education somewhere else or living like somewhere around the Bay Area and commuting into San Francisco and working

question: What is the sense of community like in San Francisco's Chinatown?
answer: Chinatown has a strong sense of community, where people often run into acquaintances and engage in conversations, reflecting a deep interconnectedness.
source_text: I just love the community in San Francisco I mean I grew up in like Chinatown and so I love just how like interconnected our community feels like growing up in like I mean North America as old as Chinatown it feels like our community has grown so much and weve been through so much together that even though like youre walking on the streets a lot of times my family we often run into people that like we didnt really know but like weve heard about them and so my parents go say hi to them and then they check a conversation about like stories from back in child and stuff like that

question: What aspects of San Francisco do you love?
answer: I love San Francisco for its traditions, food, scenery, architecture, and the community with different cultural neighborhoods like the Castro, the Mission, and Chinatown.
source_text: I do love San Francisco I love like all the traditions and I love like all the like I love the food too good I love the um just like the scenery in the buildings everything the architecture is really you know yeah Im like adding lots of work both um this is what Im saying I also like really love the community like having different like cultural neighborhoods for example which I know the planning department has been working on like for example um like the Castro with their lgbtq plus Community the um the mission for example and Chinatown 2 which I know its not a cultural neighborhood but still its like a really its like a cultural inkling still and I think thats like a really crucial part of what I love about San Francisco

question: What are your future plans regarding living in San Francisco?
answer: I want to pursue higher education far from San Francisco, maybe on the East Coast or SoCal, but I fully intend to come back to San Francisco after my studies.
source_text: as for what aspirative um Im looking to come back to San Francisco I think its something complicated question um I feel like when anyones asked me if or where I want to pursue higher education Ive always told them that I want to go far like I want to go maybe like East Coast or SoCal and I dont want to stay anywhere too close to the city thats the same like the same time I know like at the back of my head I fully intentionally come back to San Francisco after uh pursuing um higher education and after um studying somewhere over here

question: Why do you find San Francisco convenient for biking?
answer: I love San Francisco because of the bike lanes, which make it convenient to go places, unlike many other cities that don't pay much attention to bikers.
source_text: I love San Francisco because uh the bike Lanes Im a biker so its pretty convenient to go places and I feel like many other cities like theres not much attention to bikers so I said its great for that

question: What improvements have you noticed in the Outer Mission area?
answer: In the Outer Mission, there was less attention back then, but now places like Coyoto Park have been renovated and are better maintained, and the Department of Public Works has been doing a great job cleaning up illegal dumping.
source_text: I agree with Jackie about like the equity plans because like in the outer Mission I feel like there was less attention back then its like when I was really young coyoto Park was renovated from like super sand like it was full of sand so its kind of dangerous to be running around or playing in it but then its been remodeled and then now its being even better maintained so I appreciate like the extra effort being put in like uh the illegal dumping on the streets uh the Department of Public Works has been doing a great job cleaning that up recently

question: What improvements would you like to see in San Francisco's neighborhoods?
answer: I would love for SF to focus more on making lesser-known neighborhoods like Bay View, Outer Mission, and Portola more mainstream by adding libraries and parklets, which would also attract tourists.
source_text: I feel like there are so many neighborhoods and so many communities in SF but a lot of times were only focused on the ones that are more like Northern like the marina or maybe North Beach or even Chinatown but I feel like there are so many that Ive forgotten like the ones where we live like the Bay View or the otter Mission orophistication Valley even Portola so I feel like I would love for SF to be moving towards more like making these like communities known also and like kind of like like mainstreaming them more is adding more libraries or adding like better like partlets also I think parklets would be a great addition to all these neighborhoods Im mentioning because I feel like we also have like pretty nice weather around here too and it would be great for like SF particular advantage of that and to like push these communities more to like the tourists that come maybe like maybe they should explore neighborhoods too
